result.execSummary:
The defendant Shurran F Hagwood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court waives court costs, fees, surcharges due to the finding of indigency.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shurran F Hagwood

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shurran F Hagwood in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: LNR
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court ordered defendant to serve 3 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days time served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

- Court WAIVES Court costs/fees/surcharges due to the finding of indigency. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  

Defendant missed office visit. Court will address at next court date.

Defendant Shurran F Hagwood in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Shurran F Hagwood in custody.  
Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Shurran F Hagwood not in court.  Ann R. Lpez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/15/15 @ 1:30 pm
